071101-d-11-03-07-DL.Contributing Accident Cause: Investigation complete, cause could not be determined (When using this code, the narrative must incl
071101-d-11-03-07-DL.Narrative: STEAMBOAT EQUIPMENT MOVEMENT OPERATING AT RESTRICTED SPEED PULLED WEST FROM THE WEST CROSSOVER TRACKOVER THE WEST CROSSOVER SWITCH (TRAILING POINT) ONTO THE SOUTH LEG OF THE STEAMTOWN WYE TO ALLOW HEADROOM TO CLEAR THE CHAMBERLAIN LEAD SWITCH, STOPPING WITH COACH #550 HALFWAY OVER THE WEST CROSSOVER SWITCH. WHILE SHOVING BACK EAST TOWARD THE CHAMBERLAIN LEAD, THE WEST TRUCK OF COACH #550 AND THEREST OF THE TRAIN DIVERTED TO THE SOUTH LEG WHILE THE BACK OF THE TRAIN STILL STRUNG THROUGH THE CROSSOVER TRACK. THE TRAIN SHOVED ANOTHER 300 FEET BEFORE STRESS OF THE COACHES BEING PULLED IN DIFFERENT DIRECTIONS CAUSED COACH #550 TO DERAIL AND THE TRAIN TO STOP. WHEN DL RAILROAD PERSONNEL ARRIVEDAT THE SCENE AND EXAMINED THE SWITCH IT WAS NOTED THAT THE SWITCH LEVER WAS OUT OF THE KEEPER AND NOT SECURED AND THE SWITCH WAS LINED NORMAL FOR MOVEMENT ONTO THE SOUTH LEG, OPPOSITE THE TRAIN'S INTENDED MOVE EAST TOWARDS THE CHAMBERLAIN LEAD. STATEMENTS FROM STEAMBOAT CREWMEN ASSIGNED TO THE TRAINDID NOT INDICATE ANYONE WAS STATIONED AT THE WEST CROSSOVER SWITCH, SINCE THE INTENT OF THE MOVE WAS A SIMPLE PULL WEST AND SHOVE EAST AFTER THE REAR OF THE TRAIN HAD CLEARED THE CHAMBERLAIN SWITCH.THE PREVIOUS MOVEMENT OVER THE WEST CROSSOVER SWITCH WAS A SET OF DL LIGHT ENGINES TOWARD THE SOUTHLEG APPROXIMATELY ONE HOUR EARLIER, THE SWITCH LINED AND SECURED IN THE NORMAL POSITION.  FURTHER EXAMINATION OF THE SWITCH POINTS AFTER THE EQUIPMENT WAS CLEARED FROM THE RAILS SEVERAL DAYS LATER I

11122007-d-11-12-07-AGCR.Narrative: PER ENGINEER ON TRACK 2, I WENT TO MAKE A CUT ON BAD ORDER CAR TO CUT OUT.  PULL UP HIGH ABOVE RIP TRACK SWITCH AND LINE SWITCH TO GO INTO RIP TRACK.  SHOVE IN ABOUT 3  CARS TO MAKE JOINT, THEN SHOVEIN ANOTHER HALF A CAR TO MAKE ANOTHER JOINT.  AFTER MAKING THAT JOINT, SHOVED IN ANOTHER 2 CARS TO MAKE ANOTHER JOINT, WHILE MAKING JOINT COMMUNICATED WITH ENGINEER TO SHOVE IN HALF A CAR TO JOINT UPWITH LAST TWO CARS IN RIP TRACK.  LET ENGINEER KNOW THAT I WAS IN RED ZONE TO COUPLE UP HOSES AND TAKE OFF HANDBRAKES.  AFTER LETTING ENGINEER KNOW THAT I WAS IN THE CLEAR, STARTED MAKING MY WAY BACKTO THE SWITCH AND TOLD ENGINEER TO TAKE CUT OF CARS TO SAN ANTONIO.  I WAS WALKING UP TO THE CLEAR POINT OF THE RIP TRACK WHEN I NOTICE WHEEL TRACKS ON THE GROUND, CAME ON RADIO TELLING ENGINEER TO COME TO A STOP.  I STARTED TO CHECK TRAIN LINE AND SAW THAT WE WERE OFF THE RAIL.  WHILE INSPECTING  WHAT CAUSED CARS TO COME OFF WAS SWITCH POINT.  WHEN MAKING FIRST JOINT IN THE RIP TRACK EVERYTHING WAS OK.  THE CAR THAT CAME OFF WAS TILX 3164 A/N SIDE WHERE THE FIRST WHEELS THAT CAME OFF GOING INTOTHE RIP TRACK.  ALSO CAR NUMBER CEFX 33112 A/N AND B/N SIDE WHERE ALSO OFF THE RAIL.  THE LAST CARNUMBER WAS NDYX 320458 B/N SIDE WAS THE RAIL.  THE CAR MBKX 286624 WAS THE ONE FOULING THE SWITCH POINT OF THE RIP TRACK ALSO MOVE THIS CAR TOWARDS SAN ANTONIO, WHILE DOING THIS CAR IT ALSO DERAILED.

574321-d-11-06-07-IC.Narrative: REMOTE JOB, RCL95271-06 PULLED 83 CARS NORTH ONTO THE SWITCHING LEAD.  THE JOB THEN BEGAN TO SHOVE SOUTH WHEN UNKNOWINGLY THE TRAIN BECAME UNCOUPLED BETWEEN THE 57TH CAR (TEIX 91) AND THE 58TH CAR (OAR 62229).  THIS CREATED A GAP BETWEEN THE HEAD 57 CARS AND THE REAR 26 CARS AND ENGINES.  THE CREW APPLIED HANDBRAKES ON THE STOPPED REAR CARS WHEN THE HEAD 57 CARS RAN INTO THE REAR 26 CARS.  THE IMPACT DERAILED 8 CARS AND CAUSED 2 OF THOSE CARS TO CROSS MAIN #1 STRIKING THE LOCOMOTIVES ON G86491-03 WHICH WAS STANDING ON MAIN #2 AND DERAILING BOTH UNITS.  IT IS UNKNOWN WHY THE TRAIN SEPARATION OCCURRED. THE CREW WAS TESTED, RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  THERE WERE NO EXPOSURES OR INJURIES.

CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND 13 LOADS DERAILED.  FOUR LOADS OF PLASTIC AND NINE LOADS OF LPG.  THERE WERE NO LEAKS OR EXPOSURES.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THE CAUSE TO BE DUE TO EXCESSIVE BUFF FORCE DUE TO TRAIN MAKE-UP. I1707-d-11-18-07-PATH.Narrative:
At approximately 1:23am, a gap train was traveling on H Track from Newark - WTC.  While crossing over the east end of the Hack Bridge, the Engineer advised Control that he lost air and could not recharge the train. He instructed the Conductor to check for a pulled emergency valve and other potential air problems.  At the same time, passengers approached the Conductor and advised that the cars were sparking, smoking and cars were jumping in the back.  Upon looking out of the window, the Engineernoticed that the rear cars were in an unusual position and advised Control.  Upon further inspection, the Engineer learned that Cars 105 and 881 derailed. Control was advised and the Conductor movedall the passengers from the rear 4 cars up to the first 3 cars and waited for the rescue train.  Approximately 210 passengers and train crewmembers were transferred to the rescue train between 2:30am& 2:45am.  Of the 210, 2 passengers complained of injury but no reports were made.  The Engineer andConductor were taken for drug and alcohol testing which both proved negative results.   Authorizedspeed in the area is 55 mph.  An estimate of the actual speed the train was traveling was not possible to ascertain, as the train did not clear a full block.  There is also no audiovisual capability in this area, at this time.    

At the scene, 3 trucks were derailed: On Car 105, the F-end truckand one axel on the B-end derailed and on Car 881, the B -end truck.  A motor was found underneath C

204045-d-11-07-07-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT G-77 WAS SHOVING INTO BAY STATES WHEN THE UP SWITCH CREW CALLED ON RADIO CHANNEL 44, (ROAD CHANNEL FOR THE RIVER) & ASKED IF G-77 WAS ON THEIR WAY TO BAY STATES AS THEY (UP) HAD CARS FOR THEM. G-77 PERFORMED SOME WORK ENROUTE TO BAY STATES. THERE WAS A LOT OF RADIO TRAFFIC ON CHANNEL 44 SO G-77 WENT OVER TO CHANNEL 41. MEANWHILE THE UP SWITCH ENGINE GATHERED CARS FOR G-77 & PULLED BEHIND G-77. THE UP CONDUCTOR INFORMED G-77'S CONDUCTOR THAT THERE WAS ONE MORE CAR TO ADD BEFORE THEY COULD LEAVE. AT THIS POINT THE UP SWTICH ENGINE WAS RIGHT BEHIND G-77'S CARS AT WALNUT STREET. G-77'SCONDUCTOR STATED HE INFORMED THE UP CONDUCTOR THAT HE HAD TO GO EAST & PUT AN EMPTY CAR INTO THE WHITAKER PASS SO THEY COULD RUN AROUND IT. DURING THIS TIME AN EMPLOYEE FROM BAY STATES WAS DISCUSSINGWITH THE UP WHAT THEY NEEDED TO DO. AFTER G-77 SETOUT CAR ON WHITAKER PASS THE UP CONDUCTOR LINED THE SWITCH BEHIND G-77 FOR #2 TRACK. G-77'S CONDUCTOR THEN WENT TO THE UP CHANNEL & TRIED TO TELL THEUP THAT HE NEEDED TO BACK UP (WEST). GETTING NO RESPONSE HE LOOKED AT HIS RADIO & FOUND HE WAS ON THE WRONG CHANNEL. AT THIS TIME G-77'S CONDUCTOR NOTICED HIS TRAIN WAS BACKING UP AND WAS NOT ABLE TOSTOP MOVEMENT BEFORE IMPACT. G-77'S ENGINEER WAS INSTRUCTED BY G-77'S BRAKEMAN TO BACKUP, BUT NEITHER OF THEM HAD CONFIRMED WITH THEIR CONDUCTOR. THE CRDX 11427 (REAR CAR) MADE SIDE CONTACT WITH UP ASSIGNMENT LOCOMOTIVE UP 496.  BOTH LOCOMOTIVE & CAR DERAILED. PER PHONE CONVERSATION 11/30 WITH UP, E

203967-d-11-02-07-SOO.Narrative: 291-01 TRAVELING WESTWARD ON TOMAH SUB (RIVER JCT) MADE CONTACT WITH IC&E TRAIN. THE IC&E TRAIN (MHUCC-01) WAS IN THE PROCESS OF CLEARING THEIR MOVEMENT FROM THE CP 'NEW SIDING' ONTO THEIR TRACKAGE ATLACRESCENT, VIA YARD TRACK #4, WHEN THEY EXPERIENCED AN EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION. 291-01 HAD RECEIVED INSTRUCTION & SIGNAL INDICATION TO UTILIZE THE SIDING FOR A MEET ONCE THE IC&E TRAIN CLEARED.291-01 HAD RECEIVED A DIVERGING APPROACH SIGNAL INTO SIDING TO STOP SIGNAL AT RIVER JCT CROSSOVER. CREW ON 291-01 WENT BY STOP SIGNAL AND STRUCK 54TH CAR OF IC&E TRAIN. SOO LOCOMOTIVE CP 9554 TIPPED ON SIDE, 2 EMPTY CARS DERAILED AND SOO CONDUCTOR SUSTAINED INJURY.  3 CARS ON THE IC&E TRAIN SUSTAINED DAMAGE AS A RESULT OF THE COLLISION ESTIMATED EQUIPMENT DAMAGES APPROX $21,500.00. NO IC&E CREW MEMBERS INJURED. Q23 - ANNUAL TRACK DENSITY, RELATES TO MAIN LINE - SIDING DENSITY FIGURES NOT AVAILABLE.

03-d-11-03-07-SNCX.Contributing Accident Cause: Investigation complete, cause could not be determined (When using this code, the narrative must incl
03-d-11-03-07-SNCX.Narrative: STEAMTOWN EQUIPMENT MOVEMENT OPERATING AT RESTRICTED SPEED PULLED WEST FROM THE STEAMTOWN RUNNING TRACK OVER THE WEST CROSSOVER SWITCH ONTO THE SOUTH LEG OF THE STEAMTOWN WYE TO ALLOW HEADROOM TO CLEAR THE CHAMBERLAIN LEAD SWITCH, STOPPING WITH COACH 550 HALFWAY OVER THE WEST CROSSOVER SWITCH.  WHILE SHOVING BACK EAST TOWARDS THE CHAMBERLAIN LEAD, THE WEST TRUCK OF COACH 550 AND THE COACHES WEST OF COACH 550 DIVERTED TO THE SOUTH LEG OF WYE WHILE THE BACK OF THE TRAIN STILL HEADED TOWARDS THE CHAMBERLAIN LEAD.  STRESS ON THE COACH BEING PULLED IN DIFFERENT DIRECTIONS CAUSED COACH 550 TO DERAILAND THE TRAIN CAME TO A STOP.  QUALIFIED STEAMTOWN PERSONNEL ARRIVED ON THE SCENE WITHIN 15 MINUTESOF THE DERAILMENT AND EXAMINED THE SWITCH.  IT WAS NOTED AT THE TIME THAT THE SWITCH LEVER WAS OUTOF THE KEEPER AND NOT MANUALLY SECURED AND THAT THE SWITCH WAS IN NORMAL POSITION FOR THE MOVEMENT ONTO THE SOUTH LEG.  STATEMENTS CREW INDICATED THAT AS THEY APPROACHED THE SWITCH.  THE ASSIGNED FIREMAN AND FIREMAN TRAINEE INFORMED THE ENGINEER THAT THE SWITCH WAS PROPERLY LINED FOR THE MOVEMENT.THE PREVIOUS MOVEMENT OVER THE WEST CROSSOVER SWITCH WAS A SET OF DL LIGHT ENGINES WHO HEADED TOWARDS THE SOUTH LEG OF THE WYE APPROXIMATELY ONE HOUR EARLIER.  DL CREW MEMBERS STATED.  AS DID THE STEAMTOWN CREW.  THAT THE SWITCH AT THE TIME THEY USED IT WAS PROPERLY LINED AND MANUALLY SECURED IN THENORMAL POSITION. 2/13/08:  CAUSE CODES WERE CORRECTED TO BE:  H211 (RADIO COMMUNICATION IMPROPER BY ENGINEER ON LSA-09 CREW); H403 (ENGINEER MOVED TRAIN WITH NO AUTHORITYIN YARD LIMITS); WHICH CAUSED H607 (FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH RESTRICTED SPEED).
